text: Madison County is a county in the U.S. state of Kentucky. As of the 2020 census, the population was 92,701. Its county seat is Richmond. The county is named for Virginia statesman James Madison, who later became the fourth President of the United States. In 1785, Madison County was formed from a part of Lincoln County, Virginia. == References == Category:1780s establishments in Virginia Category:1785 establishments in the United States Category:Kentucky counties
title: Madison County, Kentucky
